meanings.definition: A large predatory fish known for its sharp teeth and aggressive behavior.
meanings.sent1: The barracuda swiftly swam through the ocean, hunting for its next meal.
meanings.sent2: I saw a barracuda at the aquarium with its long, silver body and menacing grin.
meanings.sent3: The barracuda challenged the shark to a race, causing quite a commotion.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp words cut through the conversation like a barracuda slicing through water.
meanings.sent5: The barracuda's fierce gaze made all the other fish scatter in fear.

meanings.definition: A fierce or predatory person or thing.
meanings.sent1: The new manager was a barracuda, always looking to outdo others in the office.
meanings.sent2: The barracuda of the business world, he was ruthless in his pursuit of success.
meanings.sent3: She was a barracuda on the dance floor, dominating every move with precision.
meanings.sent4: His competitive nature was like that of a barracuda, never backing down from a challenge.
meanings.sent5: The barracuda of the playground, he ruled over the games with an iron fist.
